meanings.definition: To surpass in feasting or eating.
meanings.sent1: During the competition, she managed to outfeast all her opponents.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outfeast his friends at the dinner table.
meanings.sent3: At the family reunion, Grandpa jokingly challenged Grandma to outfeast him.
meanings.sent4: Her appetite was like a beast, ready to outfeast anyone in her path.
meanings.sent5: The buffet was a battlefield, and she was determined to outfeast them all.

meanings.definition: To consume more food than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She could easily outfeast her siblings during meal times.
meanings.sent2: The competitive eater aimed to outfeast his opponent in the eating contest.
meanings.sent3: The hungry dog managed to outfeast the cat's food while no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: His hunger seemed insatiable, always striving to outfeast those around him.
meanings.sent5: The food challenge required contestants to outfeast each other to win the prize.

meanings.definition: To have a larger or more extravagant feast than others.
meanings.sent1: The royal banquet aimed to outfeast all previous celebrations.
meanings.sent2: Their wedding feast would surely outfeast any other event in the village.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors tried to outfeast each other with elaborate holiday dinners.
meanings.sent4: The cruise ship's buffet was designed to outfeast all other dining experiences.
meanings.sent5: The chef's goal was to outfeast all other chefs with his culinary creations.
